alert.note: Alert for Iron; Madison (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 3:23AM CST until February 22 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following areas, Iron MO, Madison MO and Reynolds MO. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Persistent moderate to heavy rainfall this morning will lead to 1 to 2 inches of rain, with locally higher amounts. The ground remains saturated from prior rainfall, making excessive runoff more likely.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
